title: School Prospectus School of Advanced Studies (SAS)

school.name: School of Advanced Studies (SAS)
school.vision_mission: The School of Advanced Studies (SAS) is envisioned as a Graduate School that stands for excellence and innovation, and that will be globally identified for the distinction of its programs and the quality of its research.
history: SLU began its collegiate programs in 1952.
In 1956, the master's program in Education received government recognition.
Expanded into various disciplines: Management Engineering (1956), English (1957), Business Management (1966), Psychology, Biology, Public Management, etc.
In 2018, SLU consolidated all graduate programs under the School of Advanced Studies (SAS).
SAS comprises 7 academic clusters: ABM, CIT, ENGG, LIBARTS, NATSCI, NRSG, TEACHED.
goals_objectives: Enhance intellect and creativity through excellent instruction, research, and extension work
Promote highest ethical standards in scholarship and practice
Hone professional and leadership skills for community and industry impact
Offer community service opportunities through extension programs
Employ expert faculty and invite international scholars
Elevate global visibility of the graduate school
